result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Biernat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 3-11-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald Biernat in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Ronald Biernat in court.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed. ccp

Defendant Ronald Biernat in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 80 days in the House of Correction,  with credit for 1 day time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 3-11-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Ronald Biernat in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case oassed from this morning. State was prepared to proceed to trial.  AS to count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Court orders count 2 dismissed and read in.  Statement to the court by Julie B.  Case is adjourned for sentencing on 11-17-2015 at 8:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.
from defense, received and filed.   mld
from defense, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Ronald Biernat in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-28-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Ronald Biernat in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-24-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Ramon Valdez  as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Valdez accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing upon the conclusion of case. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-2-2015 at 8:30 am.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Julie B. or J.A.B. (dob 8-27-1998) and no firearms in possession, until further order of the Court.   mld
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Julie B. or J.A.B. or the residence or place of employment

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.vb
